page.title: 04Balmullo Primary School
page.content: The Primary School was built in 1976 and it has quite an unusual design. All the classrooms are built around the circular hall. So the basic shape of the school is round, except for the office area. There are six classrooms. One is used as a library/resources room and one as a music/T.V. room. The three pairs of classrooms have "wet areas" between them. These areas have sinks, art-storage drawers and vinyl floors. The toilets and coat trolleys are in these areas too. Outside we have a large playground and grassed area. There is a football pitch, a netball court and many markings for games such as hopscotch. At the moment, we have 110 pupils aged 4 1/2 to 11 1/2. When we leave P.7, most of us will go to Bell Baxter High School in Cupar.
